cause.description:
Cystic Fibrosis is an inherited disease of the mucus & sweat glands. It affects mostly your lungs, pancreas, liver, intestines, sinuses & sex organs. CF causes your mucus to be thick & sticky. The mucus clogs the lungs, causing breathing problems & making it easy for bacteria to grow. This can lead to problems such as repeated lung infections & lung damage.
Although there is no cure for CF, treatments have improved greatly in recent years. Until the 1980's, most deaths from CF occurred in children & teenagers. Today, with improved treatments, people with CF live, on average, to be more then 35 years old.
1. CF affects the body's ability to move salt & water in & out of cells
2. 3'000 babies are born with CF every year
3. Please help bring awareness to those who may have never heard of CF
cause.name: Cystic Fibrosis Awareness
